events.title: Charlemagne Becomes Sole King of the Franks
events.description: After the death of his brother Carloman I, Charlemagne becomes the sole ruler of the Frankish Kingdom, laying foundations for the Carolingian Empire.
events.significance: This event marks the beginning of Charlemagne's sole rulership, which greatly influenced the political landscape of medieval Europe.

events.title: The United States Bill of Rights Becomes Law
events.description: The first ten amendments to the United States Constitution, known as the Bill of Rights, are ratified and become law.
events.significance: These amendments established fundamental liberties and protections for individuals, shaping American democracy.

events.title: Hungary Declares Independence from the Austro-Hungarian Empire
events.description: Following the collapse of the Austro-Hungarian Empire after World War I, the Hungarian Democratic Republic is proclaimed.
events.significance: Marking a significant shift in Central European politics, this event ended centuries of Habsburg rule over Hungary.

events.title: United Nations Established
events.description: The United Nations officially comes into existence with 51 founding member countries.
events.significance: Creating a platform for international diplomacy and conflict resolution after World War II, it remains a major global institution.

events.title: Fidel Castro Resigns as President of Cuba
events.description: Fidel Castro resigns as President due to health issues, ending an era of direct leadership since the Cuban Revolution.
events.significance: This marked a significant transition in Cuban leadership and had implications for international relations during the post-Cold War period.
